Laura Alexander , a 2010 graduate of Pembroke High School , has become the second Hobart and William Smith student this academic year to earn a Fulbright U.S. Student Award to support an English Teaching Assistantship .
A double major in writing and rhetoric and English , Alexander will begin teaching English in Malaysia this fall .
A double major in writing and rhetoric and English , Alexander will begin teaching English in Malaysia this fall .
Last spring , Alexander traveled to Thailand with 26 other students in the first trip of the new January - term program offered through the Center for Global Education .
Following that course , The Revolutionary Power of a Love - In with Elephants : Environmentalism , Peace and Healing in Thailand , Alexander knew she wanted to return to Southeast Asia .

Following the Fulbright , Alexander plans to pursue graduate studies in social work or public health with the aim of working further in the education sector .

The program is designed to increase mutual understanding between the people of the U.S. and numerous nations around the world .

RelatedSentence: Recipients are selected for their academic merit and leadership qualities , and will spend a year living , studying , teaching and conducting research abroad in effort to promote mutual understanding through intellectual freedom , academic integrity and openness .
